content: On August 12, 1973, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Cincinnati Reds in a memorable game that showcased the power of Hank Aaron. In this contest, Aaron hit his 700th career home run, becoming just the third player in MLB history to reach that milestone, joining Babe Ruth and Willie Mays. This historic achievement solidified Aaron's legacy as one of the greatest sluggers in baseball history and marked a significant moment in Braves franchise lore.
